DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Monocyte Infiltration Percentage Cell Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by monocytes in a tumor sample or specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.:The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI):A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.:The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI):A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

Concepts.definition: Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.
The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the percentage value for a cell count.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.

DataElement.changeDescription: 12/11/14 jc added Exceptional Responder CSI.  Curated to support The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) 2009
